title: The 2.0.0 version of the schema for the RSMF manifest file

version.title: RSMF version
version.description: The version of the RSMF specification that the file adheres to.

items.title: Participant
items.description: A participant is someone who has participated in at least one of the events described in the manifest.

id.title: Participant ID
id.description: Uniquely identifies a participant within the manifest.

display.title: Participant display name
display.description: Value used to display the participant.

avatar.title: Participant avatar image file
avatar.description: The name of a file within the rsmf.zip, including any extension, that contains an image to display for the avatar for the participant. PNG, JPG, and GIF image formats are supported.

account_id.title: Participant account ID
account_id.description: The primary ID that distinguishes the participant in the application.

custom.title: Custom participant properties
custom.description: An array of name/value objects that can be used to store additional metadata about the participant. You can define any number additional pieces of metadata. Any string, number, or boolean value will be displayed by the Viewer when a user hovers over a participant.

items.title: Conversation
items.description: A conversation is a time-bound set of short message events that occur on a specific platform, such as Slack, Bloomberg, or SMS.

id.title: Conversation ID
id.description: Uniquely identifies a conversation within the manifest.

display.title: Participant display
display.description: Value used to display the conversation.

platform.title: Conversation platform
platform.description: The name of the platform from which the conversation originated.

type.title: Conversation type
type.description: Determines the type of the conversation. Valid values are 'direct' and 'channel'. When 'direct', this indicates that the participants do not change during the  conversation. When 'channel', this indicates that participants may enter and leave the conversation at various points in time.

participants.title: Conversation participants
participants.description: List of participants associated with the conversation. When the type of the associated conversation is 'direct', this list will be all of the participants that took part in the conversation. When the type of the associated conversation is 'channel', this list will be all of the participants who were in the conversation at the time of the earliest event described for that conversation in the manifest.

items.title: Participant ID
items.description: The ID of a participant in the conversation. This must map back to the ID of a Participant identified in the root of the manifest.

custodian.title: Conversation custodian
custodian.description: The id of a participant who was the source of the conversation. This must map back to one of the participants in the conversation.

custom.title: Custom conversation properties
custom.description: An array of name/value objects that can be used to store additional metadata about the conversation. You can define any number additional pieces of metadata. Any string, number, or boolean value will be displayed by the Viewer when a user hovers over a conversation.

icon.title: Conversation icon
icon.description: The name of a file within the rsmf.zip, including any extension, that contains an image to display for the icon for the conversation. We expect this icon to be the logo for the platform the data was pulled from.

events.title: Events
events.description: An array of short message events.

items.title: Short message event
items.description: An event is any discrete activity that can happen within the confines a conversation.

id.title: Event ID
id.description: Uniquely identifies an event within a conversation. An event only needs to have an identifier if it is part of a thread.

type.title: Event type
type.description: Defines the type of the event.

parent.title: Event parent ID
parent.description: Identifies the parent event of the event. This needs to be set if the event is a message which is a part of a thread. This must map back to the id of another event in the same conversation.

body.title: Event body
body.description: Content associated with the event. Not all event types require a body. For a message type, this would be the text of the message.

participant.title: Event participant
participant.description: The participant that is the source of the event. This must map to the ID of a participant defined in the root of the manifest.

conversation.title: Event conversation
conversation.description: Identifies the conversation in which the event occurred. This must map back to the id of a conversation defined in the root of the manifest.

timestamp.title: Event timestamp
timestamp.description: A value that corresponds to when the event occurred. This must be a date/time value in a format that conforms to the ISO8601 standard.

deleted.title: Event deleted
deleted.description: Identifies whether an event has been deleted.

importance.title: Event importance
importance.description: Sets an importance value for the event.

reactions.title: Event reactions
reactions.description: An array of reactions associated with the event.

value.title: Reaction value
value.description: Identifies the reaction. Reactions without visual support will be displayed as text instead. See <url> for a list of supported reactions with visual support.

count.title: Reaction count
count.description: The number of times this reaction was added to the event.

participants.description: An array of participants who provided the reaction.
participants.title: Reaction participants

items.title: Participant ID
items.description: The ID of a participant who provided the reaction. This must map back to the ID of a participant defined in the root of the manifest.

attachments.title: Event attachments
attachments.description: An array of attachments associated with the event.

id.title: Attachment ID
id.description: Identifies the attachment. The value should correspond to the name of a file within the rsmf.zip, including any extension.

display.title: Attachment display
display.description: The value to display for the attachment. If the display for the file ends in .png, .jpg, .jpeg, or .gif the system will assume the attachment is an image will attempt to display it inline.

size.title: Attachment file size
size.description: The size of the file in bytes. This is used for display purposes only.

edits.title: Event edits
edits.description: An array of edits associated with the event.

participant.title: Participant ID
participant.description: The participant that is the source of the event. This must map to the ID of a participant defined in the root of the manifest.

timestamp.title: Edit timestamp
timestamp.description: A value that corresponds to when the edit occurred. This must be a date/time value in a format that conforms to the ISO8601 standard.

previous.title: Edit previous
previous.description: The value of the previous body that was changed due to the edit.

new.title: Edit new
new.description: The value of the new body once the edit was made

custom.title: Custom event properties
custom.description: An array of name/value objects that can be used to store additional metadata about the event. You can define any number additional pieces of metadata. Any string, number, or boolean value will be displayed by the Viewer when a user hovers over an event.

direction.title: Event direction
direction.description: Helps reviewers understand whose device this information was collected from, relative to the custodian.

read_receipts.title: Event read receipts
read_receipts.description: An array of read receipts associated with the event.

participant.title: Participant ID
participant.description: The participant that made the edit. This must map to the id of a participant defined in the root of the manifest.

timestamp.title: Read receipt timestamp
timestamp.description: The timestamp (ISO8601) of when the edit occurred.

action.title: Read receipt action
action.description: If the recipient was delivered the message, and/or read the message.

eventcollectionid.title: RSMF event collection id
eventcollectionid.description: A unique ID that is used to help keep many RSMFs from a single conversation together.
